body: Perhaps I'm missing something but what is the error?  Isn't that the [correct usage](https://docs.python.org/3/library/typing.html?highlight=typing%20callable#typing.ParamSpec) of `P.args`?

> Perhaps I'm missing something but what is the error? Isn't that the [correct usage](https://docs.python.org/3/library/typing.html?highlight=typing%20callable#typing.ParamSpec) of `P.args`?

It's invalid to use only `P.args` in a function. You have to use `P.args` _and_ `P.kwargs`, or neither. This is specified in PEP 612 (https://peps.python.org/pep-0612/#id1), but isn't currently mentioned in the `typing.py` docs (maybe it should be).

> It's invalid to use only `P.args` in a function. You have to use `P.args` _and_ `P.kwargs`, or neither. This is specified in PEP 612 (https://peps.python.org/pep-0612/#id1), but isn't currently mentioned in the `typing.py` docs (it probably should be).

Ah, thanks!
@AlexWaygood would you care to create an issue about that?

> @AlexWaygood would you care to create an issue about that?

About the CPython docs?

Yes, about:

> It's invalid to use only P.args in a function. You have to use P.args and P.kwargs, or neither. This is specified in PEP 612 (https://peps.python.org/pep-0612/#id1), but isn't currently mentioned in the typing.py docs (maybe it should be).

issue.title: Mypy 0.990 Release Planning
issue.body:
I am planning to make a 0.990 release around late October.

Please post here any issues you'd like to see fixed in the release, or PRs you'd like to have merged. There is no release branch yet - I will update the issue once it exists.
